cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles W of Key West, FL
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn N-NW tonight and then N-NE on Wednesday, tracking toward Florida’s Big Bend and then accelerating northeastward along/just inland of the southeast U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key/Indian Pass area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass; Tropical-Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Gulf Coast from Bonita Beach northward through the Big Bend and up the southeast U.S. coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible Thursday afternoon through early Friday, highest risk Thursday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible along the lower Tampa Bay/Manatee County shoreline if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible, producing urban and low-lying flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave heights could halt cargo operations; brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain-bands.
